Articles.Content: This is the Mosquito, a prototype of a interplanetary vessel meant for travel to celestial objects with substantial atmospheres. The Mosquito is basically an airplane put upside down onto a rocket. With its atmospheric engine, the plane-part of the ship probably won't function on extra-terrestrial worlds with atmospheres due to the lack of oxygen, but its a nice but rough concept of what could be a efficient vessel capable of extensive exploration of strange new worlds.

The way it is,the cockpit point to the ground wich cause drag.

Try to reverse the cockpit so it point to the sky(at the launch),you will certainly use less fuel!
Very cool! Unfortunately, though, the atmospheric engines will not work in the atmospheres of other planets,as they have no oxygen.
We don't know that they don't have oxygen.

The way it is,the cockpit point to the ground wich cause drag.

Try to reverse the cockpit so it point to the sky(at the launch),you will certainly use less fuel!

That's not how drag works in KSP.
I'll probably have to redesign the vessel when aerodynamics are correctly implemented. And for now add a few struts, the ship is wobbling a bit too much.
I thought it was the Mosquito From Planetside 2
